title: Dataset config files are installed by pip
body:
I was trying out the mnist example but I got the following error when I tried to run

`training_set, test_set, _ = mnist.load(split=True)`

```
FileNotFoundError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-f56690ea9fba> in <module>()
----> 1 training_set, test_set, _ = mnist.load(split=True)

3 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/mnist/__init__.py in load(cache_dir, split)
     30 
     31 def load(cache_dir=DEFAULT_CACHE_LOCATION, split=False):
---> 32     dataset = Mnist(cache_dir=cache_dir)
     33     return dataset.load(split=split)
     34 

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/mnist/__init__.py in __init__(self, cache_dir)
     49 
     50     def __init__(self, cache_dir=DEFAULT_CACHE_LOCATION):
---> 51         super().__init__(dataset_name="mnist", cache_dir=cache_dir)
     52 
     53     def process_downloaded_dataset(self):

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/base_dataset.py in __init__(self, dataset_name, cache_dir)
     42         self.cache_dir = cache_dir
     43 
---> 44         self.config = read_config(dataset_name)
     45         self.version = self.config["version"]
     46 

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/base_dataset.py in read_config(dataset_name)
     27 def read_config(dataset_name):
     28     config_path = os.path.join(PATH_HERE, f"{dataset_name}/config.yaml")
---> 29     with open(config_path) as config_file:
     30         return yaml.safe_load(config_file)
     31 

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/mnist/config.yaml'
```

When I look into where ludwig is installed it seems that the mnist dataset's `config.yaml` file isn't installed

```
$ ls /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/datasets/mnist
__init__.py __pycache__
```

I checked for sst2, sst5, reuters, and ohsumed and they were all missing their config.yaml files

**Environment:**
 - OS: I tried this on MacOS Catalina v10.15.7 and in a Google Colab notebook
- Python version: 3.7.2 (local), 3.6.9 (google colab)
- Ludwig version: 0.3.1
